headline: CHD Q1 Earnings Call: Portfolio Pruning and Tariff Actions Amid Consumer Weakness
summary: Household products company Church & Dwight (NYSE:CHD) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales falling 2.4% year on year to $1.47 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s outlook exceeded expectations with revenue guided to $1.5 billion at the midpoint, or 1.3% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.91 per share was 1.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
